message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS 

This paper proposes a novel online learning algorithm for Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBM) that provides the ability to build and adapt the network architecture of RBM according to the statistics of streaming data. The paper focuses on the application of RBM in classification problems and demonstrates its performance on various datasets. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other likely sub-categories include cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper proposes a new algorithm for RBM. Additionally, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also a possible sub-category as the paper applies the proposed algorithm on the MNIST dataset. Finally, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also a possible sub-category as the paper discusses the use of RBM in non-stationary data mining applications.
